string-array.name: animal_desc
string-array.item: The lion is a large, muscular cat with a short, tawny coat, a tufted tail, and, in males, a distinctive mane. Known as the "king of the jungle," lions live in prides and are found primarily in Africa.

The eagle is a powerful bird of prey with keen eyesight, a hooked beak, and strong talons. Eagles are known for their majestic flight and are found in various habitats around the world, including mountains and coastal regions.

The hawk is a medium-sized bird of prey known for its sharp vision and powerful flight. Hawks have broad wings and long tails, and they inhabit a wide range of environments, from forests to open plains.

The rhino, short for rhinoceros, is a large, thick-skinned herbivore known for its impressive horn(s) on its snout. Rhinos are found in Africa and Asia and are often characterized by their massive bodies and protective demeanor.

The tiger is a large, solitary cat with a striking orange coat and black stripes. Tigers are apex predators found primarily in Asia\'s forests and grasslands, known for their strength, stealth, and powerful hunting abilities.
